title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 August 2016 - XWiki
content:
<boubou> has quit  
01:03 <boubou> has joined #xwiki  
03:17 <jonesmeier> has quit  
06:44 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:15 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:01 <mflorea> has quit  
08:56 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <vmassol> mflorea: good monring  
11:42 <vmassol> regarding http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13468  
11:42 <vmassol> I see the affects version is 8.1  
11:42 <vmassol> does it mean the issue is not there on 7.4.x?  
11:48 <mflorea> vmassol: good morning, I updated the affects version  
11:48 <vmassol> thanks  
13:40 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <acotiuga> has quit  
14:25 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <msmeria> has quit  
15:46 <hakin> has quit  
16:01 <hakin> has joined #xwiki  
16:02 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <xavier\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:50 <vmassol> wow  
16:50 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13616?focusedCommentId=92324&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-92324  
16:50 <vmassol> :)  
16:51 <vmassol> so we"ve found a use case when the functional tests doesn't behave the same as XE and is thus missing an error....  
16:51 <vmassol> xwiki is really starting to be complex....  
16:52 <evalica> try saying it as a joke during a party :)  
16:52 <vmassol> :)  
16:52 <vmassol> a geek party then  
16:52 <vmassol> ...  
16:52 <evalica> :)  
16:53 <vmassol> so in the end it's because of Enygma` :)  
16:53 <vmassol> with his realtime watchlist feature!  
16:53 <vmassol> lol  
16:54 <vmassol> this feature made the mail sender thread execute before a first request has been sent  
16:58 <vmassol> now I need to find a way to modify the func tests for this....  
16:58 <vmassol> that's difficult  
16:58 <vmassol> ofc I could add a dep on watcjlist but it' not very nice  
16:59 <vmassol> I could also create a test component that is an EventListener and has a dep on MailSender but it's a bit artificial too  
17:00 <vmassol> I could also just fix the problem and not have a test for it, considering it's a special issue….  
17:00 <Enygma`> vmassol: sounds like you`ve filled your day :)  
17:00 <vmassol> yeah took me a few hours  
17:00 <vmassol> first time I'm seeing this kind of problem  
17:02 <vmassol> I could easily add a unit tests to show that preparecontext creates a stub context but it doesn't prove anything directly  
17:05 <vmassol> hmm I could also change the way the mail threads are sta rted and move that outside of initialize()...  
17:06 <vmassol> hmm no  
17:06 <vmassol> no need  
17:06 <vmassol> we may want to send mail durinfg xwiki init in the future  
17:06 <vmassol> (and befpre any request has been done)  
17:07 <vmassol> hmm actually this would probably not work  
17:07 <vmassol> since the config would not be correct....  
17:08 <acotiuga> has quit  
17:40 <mflorea> has quit  
18:02 <xavier\_\_> Hi!  
18:02 <xavier\_\_> I'm getting error with url encoding in my dev machine (CentOS, Tomcat 8.5.4). However, in my local machine (Ubuntu 15.10, Tomcat 8.5.4), i havent this error. Can someone help me?  
18:31 <xavier\_\_> has quit  
18:32 <xavier\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
19:03 <vmassol> xavier\_\_:  
19:03 <vmassol> xavier\_\_: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Encoding ?  
19:06 <evalica> has quit  
19:09 <Enygma`> has quit  
19:25 <xavier\_\_> tks vmassol. I accessed this link yesterday and ckecked configurations in web.xml, xwiki.cfg, $tomcathome/conf/server.xml. All these files are OK according the link that you provided.  
19:26 <xavier\_\_> Are there another configuration necessary? I made the standard xwiki installation in both machines: local and dev  
19:41 <vmassol> xavier\_\_: AFAIK these are the only configs we know that are related to encoding  
19:42 <vmassol> to help you further we'll need to know the problems you have, best is to send a mail to the list with the error you get  
20:04 <xavier\_\_> i will do it. tks :)  
20:04 <vmassol> thx  
20:30 <Chuguniy> has quit  
20:37 <Slashman> has quit  
20:59 <boubou> Vince, I run XWiki with a Glassfish Server  
21:00 <boubou> is there a way to see why my CPU its staled at 100% ?  
21:00 <boubou> java use all my process  
21:59 \* mmercer cries  
21:59 <mmercer> i f\* HATE!!!!!! confluence!!!!!  
22:00 <mmercer> thanks to their wysiwyg editor, I just lost about 1.5 hours of format work because of bugs in it (it just bolded every piece of text on the page, including those in element features (code blocks, etc)... the best part?  you can't actually adjust formatting dynamically in code blocks :|  
22:18 <vmassol> mmercer: doh….  
22:18 <vmassol> now you just need to convince them to switch to xwiki…  
22:19 <vmassol> boubou: you'd need to use a java profiler to get inside the JVM  
22:19 <vmassol> more simply you could try using javaemody  
22:19 <vmassol> javamelody  
22:19 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Monitoring  
22:20 <vmassol> that could help you find out where the problem is  
22:20 <vmassol> which requests are taking time, etc  
22:24 <vmassol> mmercer: hehe for the tweet ;)  
22:25 <vmassol> has quit  
22:25 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:34 <mmercer> vmassol: given how much they have invested in atlassian, dont think ill win that one.  it is oh so tempting dumping the entire confluence wiki into an xwiki and showing them how plainless it is =D  
22:34 <mmercer> but you guys still get my love, does that count ? =D  
22:39 <vmassol> yes that's the most important !  
22:39 <vmassol> :)  
22:49 <mmercer> ccccccevneutcblrkrjfrnnigikcgjnknuthbbbvtvbl  
22:49 <mmercer> oops  
22:52 <vmassol> has quit  
23:07 <mmercer> i still find it amusing that confluence team doesn't understand that taking away the wiki syntax was \*bad\* for developers trying to write documentation.  wysiwyg is sooooo much slower to accurately write in a presentable format =D   when you're as anal retentive/ocd as i am about document presentation, xwiki is a godsend thanks to still supporting wiki syntax
